meanings.definition: The act of completely destroying or wiping out something.
meanings.sent1: The obliteration of the sandcastle saddened the child.
meanings.sent2: The city faced total obliteration after the earthquake.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the sudden obliteration of the playing card.
meanings.sent4: The storm brought an obliteration of all the colorful leaves from the trees.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes created an image of complete obliteration on the canvas.

meanings.definition: The state of being completely destroyed or wiped out.
meanings.sent1: The forest fire left behind a scene of utter obliteration.
meanings.sent2: The obliteration of the village was a tragic event in the town's history.
meanings.sent3: The obliteration of the cake at the party left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent4: The old building stood as a symbol of past obliteration and renewal.
meanings.sent5: The battlefield showed signs of recent obliteration from the fierce battle.
